title: TikTok: Collected Reports
description:
This is a collection of reports on TikTok written for the Congressional Research Service with the aim of informing U.S. legislative debate. These reports describe the history of TikTok, how it works, and why some want TikTok banned in the U.S. Most of the reports focus on the legal issues and legislative proposals surrounding TikTok. The potential ramifications of banning TikTok are also discussed.

The oldest report was released on June 30, 2023, and the most recent report was released on April 25, 2024. - Summary by Elsie Selwyn

sections.title: Restricting TikTok (Part I): Legal History and Background (September 28, 2023)
Restricting TikTok (Part II): Legislative Proposals and Considerations for Congress (March 15, 2024)
Montana's TikTok Ban, an Injunction, and Pending Legal Actions (December 8, 2023)
H.R. 7521 Regulation of TikTok: Analysis of Selected Legal Issues (March 20, 2024)
TikTok: Frequently Asked Questions and Issues for Congress, Part 1 (April 9, 2024)
TikTok: Frequently Asked Questions and Issues for Congress, Part 2 (April 9, 2024)
TikTok: Frequently Asked Questions and Issues for Congress, Part 3 (April 9, 2024)
TikTok and China's Digital Platforms: Issues for Congress (April 25, 2024)
